greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers m such that the sum of the first k divisors of m, for some k, is equal to the sum of its other divisors.
comment: Includes all the perfect numbers (A000396), for them k = d(m) - 1 and the even 3-perfect numbers (A005820), for them k = d(m) - 2 (where d(m) = A000005(m) is the number of divisors of m).
example: 6 is a term since its set of divisors, {1, 2, 3, 6}, can be partitioned into two disjoint sets with equal sum, {1, 2, 3} and {6}, such that the first 3 divisors are in the first set.
results.author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 27 2020
